definitions.definition: A stooped or curled posture; a slouch.
definitions.example: The old man walked with a hunch.

definitions.definition: A theory, idea, or guess; an intuitive impression that something will happen.
definitions.example: I have a hunch they'll find a way to solve the problem.

definitions.definition: A hunk; a lump; a thick piece.
A push or thrust, as with the elbow.
To bend the top of one's body forward while raising one's shoulders.
definitions.example: Don't hunch over your computer if you want to avoid neck problems.

definitions.definition: To raise (one's shoulders) (while lowering one's head or bending the top of one's body forward); to curve (one's body) forward (sometimes followed by up).
definitions.example: He hunched up his shoulders and stared down at the ground.

definitions.definition: To walk (somewhere) while hunching one's shoulders.
To thrust a hump or protuberance out of (something); to crook, as the back.
To push or jostle with the elbow; to push or thrust against (someone).
To have a hunch, or make an intuitive guess.
